alert.note: Alert for Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 12:49PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...Northern Inner Channel rivers and streams rising to near bankfull Saturday... Heavy rain from the Atmospheric River moving into the Haines, Skagway and Juneau areas will cause many area rivers and streams to rapidly rise to near bankfull late Friday night into Saturday. Around 1 to 3 inches of rainfall is expected through Saturday across the area with the heaviest rainfall expected Friday night and Saturday. Flooding potential remains low, but any substantial changes in rainfall rate or totals could result in higher or lower observed river levels. The most significant impacts are expected along the Chilkat River near Haines and Klukwan and the Taiya River near Skagway where water levels are expected to rise to bankful conditions by Saturday afternoon. Near Juneau, Jordan Creek has the best potential to reach bankfull stage, but is expected to stay below it. All area rivers and streams are expected to be running higher then usual due to the rainfall this weekend. Recreators in and around other area rivers and streams should be prepared for rising water for the holiday weekend.

area.areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway
